bibl.title: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Rose Carter, May 30, 1914

div1.p: Ross discusses the opening of a Tropical School in Hamburg.

div1.head: Letter from Ronald Ross to Henry Rose Carter, May 30, 1914
div1.opener:
FROM
SIR RONALD ROSS, K.C.B., F.R.S.
TELEPHONE & TELEGRAMS
6328 MAYFAIR.
18, CAVENDISH SQUARE,
LONDON, W.
30th May, 1914.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
United States Public Health Service,
Mobile, Alabama.
My dear Dr. Carter.
div1.p:
It is a great pleasure to hear again from you and
also to receive your excellent article on Screening. I see
that it is full of practical notes, just as I would expect from
you.

Both Dr. Malcolm Watson and Dr. David Thomson came
home full of Panama. We gave a dinner to Gorgas, and Oxford
made him a Doctor and we were all delighted with his visit. I
have just returned from the opening of the great new Tropical
School at Hamburg. It puts the Anglo-Saxon entirely into the
shade and our poor little tropical schools are now not worth
mentioning. I hope that you are very well. When I saw you
and when you last wrote to me, your health was not good and I
sincerely trust that it has now improved. Please accept compliments
